alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 11 at 7:15PM CDT until August 12 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CDT SATURDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... The Heat Advisory for today has expired as heat indices have fallen below advisory criteria. A Heat Advisory remains in effect for Saturday from noon to 7 PM. * WHAT...Heat index values up to 115 expected. * WHERE...Portions of Deep South Texas. * WHEN...From noon to 7 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
